title: Bivalirudin in Combination with Heparin to Control Mesenchymal Cell Procoagulant Activity
patient: The third patient was a 17-years-old suffering from glycogenosis type 1a, as documented by genetic analysis (G188R mutation and 380insC insertion) and the absence of glucose-6 phosphatase activity on a liver biopsy. The patient also received antibiotic prophylaxis prior to the placement of the portal catheter as well as steroids before the infusion. The same immunosuppressor regimen as patient 2 was administered. The patient received 3 billion progenitor cells administered in seven infusions over 3 days aimed at controlling recurrent hypoglycemia. The same anticoagulation protocol and coagulation, including liver Doppler ultrasound follow-up, was applied.
